description: VRF V2 and V1 will be deprecated on November 29, 2024. Please migrate to VRF V2.5 before then.
title: VRF V2 and V1 Deprecation Announcement

changes.linkDescription: The Chainlink CCIP local simulator is available to enhance your development workflow with CCIP. This tool allows you to simulate Chainlink CCIP functionality locally within your Hardhat and Foundry projects. The simulator is designed so you can test your contracts locally and transition smoothly to test networks without any modifications.
changes.linkText: See the Chainlink CCIP local simulator GitHub repository to get started.

description: Chainlink CCIP is now Generally Available (GA) on mainnet and testnet.
title: Chainlink CCIP GA

urls.linkDescription: To support your development and implementation needs, we encourage you to reach out to our team of experts for guidance and support. For expert advice, visit the Chainlink CCIP Contact form.

description: Chainlink CCIP is now Generally Available (GA) on mainnet and testnet.
title: Chainlink Node v2.13.0

urls.linkText: See the release notes on GitHub.

description: Chainlink's CCIP now supports WETH (Wrapped Ether) transfers through the Lock and Unlock token mechanism. This feature allows CCIP to securely lock tokens on the source blockchain and subsequently release an equivalent amount of tokens on the destination blockchain, facilitating seamless cross-chain transfers of WETH. The introduction of this mechanism enables WETH transfers across several key lanes.
title: WETH and support of Lock and Unlock mechanism

urls.linkDescription: For a specific lane configuration, see the Supported Networks page.
For more detailed information about the Lock and Unlock mechanism and its applications, read the Token Pools page.

description: The maximum gasLimit that you can set for CCIP messages on mainnet has been increased to 3,000,000 gas units. The change has been documented in the Service Limits page.
title: Gas limit increase on Mainnet

description: CCIP v1.0.0 is no longer supported on mainnet. You must use the new router addresses listed in the CCIP v1.2.0 configuration page.
title: Gas limit increase on Mainnet

description: Learn about 11 different ways to use Chainlink Functions in your decentralized applications.
title: Using Chainlink Functions in your dApps

changes.linkDescription: Native tokens are now supported for payments in addition to LINK.
changes.linkText: Support for native gas token billing

changes.linkDescription: The UI now supports one-click migration to future new versions of VRF.
New billing model: The premium is a percentage of the gas costs of the VRF callback instead of a flat fee.

description: VRF V2.5 is available on Ethereum, BNB Chain, Polygon, Avalanche and Arbitrum mainnets and testnets.
title: VRF v2.5

urls.linkDescription: Scaling Onchain Verifiable Randomness With Chainlink VRF v2.5
